Class TestImageContrast

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    remy Allows to test classical operations on contrast and brightness.

    • Method Detail

      • testContrastBrightnessHistogram

        public static void testContrastBrightnessHistogram(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                                   java.lang.String outputFile1,
                                                   java.lang.String outputFile2,
                                                   double constrastFactor,
                                                   double brightnessFactor)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Validates image contrast and brightness changes through Histogram generation and visualization. The histogram of the scaled image is smoothed to avoid ragged variations.
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile - the source file for image data.
        outputFile1 - output text file for the histogram before contrast operation.
        outputFile2 - output text file for the histogram after contrast operation.
        constrastFactor - parameter (between 0 and 1) to enhance contrast
        brightnessFactor - parameter (between 0 and 1) to enhance brightness
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        ImageContrast.adjustContrastBrightness(double, double)

      • testAdjustValuesRangeHistogram

        public static void testAdjustValuesRangeHistogram(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                                  java.lang.String outputFile1,
                                                  java.lang.String outputFile2,
                                                  double min,
                                                  double max)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Validates image colors scaling through Histogram generation and visualization. The histogram of the scaled image is smoothed to avoid ragged variations.
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile - the source file for image data.
        outputFile1 - output text file for the histogram before contrast operation.
        outputFile2 - output text file for the histogram after contrast operation.
        min - The minimum value of the display range that remains, between 0.0 and 1.0.
        max - The maximum value of the display range that remains, between 0.0 and 1.0.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        ImageContrast.adjustValuesRange(double, double)

      • testContrastBrightnessWriteToFile

        public static void testContrastBrightnessWriteToFile(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                                     java.lang.String outputFile,
                                                     double constrastFactor,
                                                     double brightnessFactor)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Validates image contrast and brightness changes
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile -
        outputFile - output image file where to save the modified image after contrast operation.
        constrastFactor - parameter (between 0 and 1) to enhance contrast
        brightnessFactor - parameter (between 0 and 1) to enhance brightness
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testDisplayRange

        public static void testDisplayRange(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                    int min,
                                    int max)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Validates image thresholding
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile -
        min - : the min threshold for display range
        max - : the max threshold for display range
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testContrastBrightness

        public static void testContrastBrightness(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                          double contrastFactor,
                                          double brightnessFactor)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Validates image thresholding
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile -
        contrastFactor - ranges between 0.0 and 1.0, Increases or decreases image contrast by varying the width of the display range. The narrower the display range, the higher the contrast
        brightnessFactor - ranges between 0.0 and 1.0, Increases or decreases image brightness by moving the display range
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
